text: Choi Sang-Ok (최상옥, 崔尙玉, 1928 ~ 2015) was the founder of Korean restaurant YongSuSan, the first restaurant in South Korea to adopt western styles of service (dining, waiting staff, etc.) with Korean food. YongSuSan means "dragon water mountain. It is the name of a mountain in Kaesung, capital of the ancient Koryo Dynasty. Ok Choi was born and raised in Kaesung. He mastered the art of both Kaesung and Royal Court style cooking. Yongsusan specializes in Kaesung and Royal Court cuisine, which is now special and difficult to come by even in Korea. ==Cookbook== == References == Category:1928 births Category:2015 deaths
